message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms and history suggest that she may be experiencing migraines. Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant that has been shown to help prevent migraines. Sumatriptan and methysergide are abortive treatments for migraines, while gabapentin is more effective for neuropathic pain.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest migraines, and the MRI confirmed normal brain structure. Among the options, Amitriptyline is a common prophylactic treatment for migraines. Sumatriptan is an acute treatment for migraines but not prophylactic. Methysergide has many side effects and may not be suitable for long-term use. Gabapentin is used for many neurological conditions but is not a common prophylactic treatment for migraines.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with recurrent severe headaches, vomiting, and sensitivity to light, indicating a diagnosis of migraines. The best prophylactic treatment for migraines is amitriptyline. Sumatriptan is an abortive medication used to treat migraines once they have started. Methysergide is also used as a prophylactic agent but has more significant side effects. Gabapentin can be used but is not as effective as amitriptyline.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient presents with a severe headache and a history of recurring headaches that last 12-24 hours. She has no visual disturbances, meningismus, or focal neurologic deficits, which suggests she may have migraines. Amitriptyline is commonly used as a prophylactic treatment for migraines. Sumatriptan is used as an abortive treatment for migraines. Methysergide can cause serious side effects and is used as a last resort treatment for migraines. Gabapentin is used to treat neuropathic pain and other conditions, but is not typically used to treat migraines.

Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant often used in prophylactic treatment of chronic migraines. Sumatriptan is more commonly used for acute treatment of migraine attacks. Methysergide is an older medication with long-term side effects and is not commonly used. Gabapentin is sometimes used in prophylactic treatment of migraines, but it is not the best option in this case.
